etymologies: mid 18th century (originally denoting a kind of Sri Lankan snake): unexplained alteration of Latin anacandaia ‘python’, from Sinhalese henakaňdayā ‘whip snake’, from hena ‘lightning’ + kaňda ‘stem’

definitions: a semiaquatic snake of the boa family that may grow to a great size, native to tropical South America.

notes.text: Genus Eunectes, family Boidae: several species, in particular the green anaconda (E. murinus)

shortDefinitions: snake of boa family that may grow to great size
